document_data.name: Riturba
document_data.mainbody:
'''House Riturba''' was a noble family of [[Sumbria]], one of the city-states of the [[Blade Kingdoms]].
{{quote|''I do find honor to be a fascinating thing. If I had killed him with a [[dagger]] in the back, I should surely have hung. Instead, I run him through before two dozen witnesses and am reckoned to be a gentleman.''|[[Gilberto Ilégo]]}}
document_data.History:
Sometime before [[1217 DR]] House Riturba fell on hard times, and they loaned a significant sum of [[ducat]]s from Gilberto Ilégo, a [[Blade Captain]] from a major Blade House of Sumbria. Ilégo was a cold, power-hungry, and cruel man. The Blade Captain foreclosed on House Riturba's loan, s deed that caused outrage. House Riturba accused Gilberto Ilégo of being a contemptible cheat, in response, Ilégo challenged the young noble Riturba accuser to a duel.

The duel took place during the [[Blade Festival]] that followed one of the Blade Kingdoms' annual "white wars." The Riturba youth was no match for a master duelist. The youth fenced using a [[rapier]] and a [[buckler]], while Gilberto Ilégo used a rapier and a short [[swordbreaker]]. The House Riturba nobleman was slain in the duel, surrounded by witnesses and overseen by a gray-bearded umpire.
